George for Galiano
  • Letter to Galiano
  • Experience
  • George's Plan
  • Bio

Accomplishments: 2014-2018

  • Zone land for 20 affordable housing units
  • Make secondary suites legal
  • Increase cottage size to 860 sq. ft.
  • Create zoning for Millard Learning Centre
  • Re-zone Finlayson Lake to Nature Preserve
  • Finalize the new Sturdies Bay parking
  • Legislate a sustainable forestry covenant for DL 79
  • Put a moratorium on commercial STVRs
  • Host ground water workshop
  • Approve Sturdies Bay Bakery permit for relocation
  • Bring Mignault and Stevens zoning into compliance
  • Adopt cell phone tower infrastructure guidelines
  • Complete Galiano foreshore protection with the Penalakut band (ongoing)
  • Change Woodstone zoning to visitor accommodation
  • Host First Nations land claims information public meeting

Affordable Housing: George's 10 Years

  • OCT, 2011: George joins the board of affordable housing society
  • JULY, 2012: Galiano Green bylaws receive 1 st reading of Bylaws 233 and 234
  • SEPT, 2014: Bylaws receive 2 nd reading
  • OCT, 2014: After 6 years and expenditures of $161,000 on studies, consultants, engineers, lawyers and fees, a request for a Public Hearing was denied
  • OCT, 2014: In protest George steps down from the Board and declares his intention to run on a platform to bring the Galiano Green application to a Public Hearing
  • NOV, 2014: George wins the election and immediately begins work with staff and Trustees to move the application forward
  • OCT, 2016: Public Hearing held
  • NOV, 2016: Bylaws read a 3 rd time.
  • JAN, 2017: Approved by the Executive Committee of the Islands Trust to allow 20 densities of affordable housing at Galiano Green
  • APR, 2017: Approved by the Minister of Community, Sport and Cultural Development
  • JUL, 2017: LTC Adopts bylaws 233 and 234
  • OCT 15, 2018: (PENDING) DPA 1 – Riparian Areas & DPA 5 – Sensitive Ecosystem approved, the final conditions to complete the 10 year saga to bring the first affordable housing project to fruition since 1975.

Letters to George

George,

I am not sure if you are going to run for the Trust again. I would be happy if you did as you bring a level of civility that has been sorely missed in those meetings. You stand up for what is good for the island both human and non-human in a way that empowers everyone in the room.
We have been lucky to have you these years and I understand entirely if that was enough.

Best to you in either of your choices,
 Janice Oakley
